NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Marine, aviation and other transport insurance services
Legal insurance and all-risk insurance services

CODIF_DATA.MA_MAIN_ACTIVITIES: Port-related activities / Maritime or inland waterway
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01G05

TITLE.P: Provision of Insurance Services for the Dover Harbour Board

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision and placement of insurance related services only for the Dover Harbour Board.

The Dover Harbour Board aims to secure maximum value from its insurance programme as well as the best service and policy terms available in the market. Therefore, Dover Harbour Board are tendering their insurances.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Renewal annually until 29.6.2021 with the option to extend the contract for a further 2 years.

INFO_ADD.P: Contract is for 3 years with the option to extend for a further 2 years.

Tenders or requests to participate must be submitted to the above mentioned address. The procurement documents are available by sending an e-mail to Joe_Hassan1@ajg.com All documents will be e-mailed by return to the applicant. Additional information can be obtained from the above mentioned address also.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Marine Package includes Hull and Machinery (Craft), Property, Computer All Risks, Legal and Contractual Liability including Professional Indemnity, Removal of Wreck, Business Interruption, Clean Up Costs, Cash, and Charters Legal Liability.

SUITABILITY.P: Bids are permitted from Insurance Companies and Managing General Agents working with specific Insurers.
Bids are only permitted from Brokers where they have the authority to submit that bid exclusively on behalf of an Insurer.
Evaluation will be undertaken as referred to within the ITT document.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Applicants are required to self-certify the availability of certain financial information. This information may be requested of the winning bidder to verify the statement made in the selection questionnaire before an award is made. Applicants should also be able to demonstrate:
a) a turnover 10 x the value of the estimated contract value for the lot being considered;

b) a positive net worth and must be authorised by the FCA to transact general insurance business in the UK. Tenderers transacting business in the UK on a passport recognised by the FCA are also eligible to bid.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Service providers shall be authorised to write the classes of insurance listed within EU member states subject to English law and jurisdiction of English Courts.

REFERENCE_TO_LAW.P: Financial Services and Market Act 2000, Insurance Companies Act 1982 and other statutory modifications thereof, and associated obligations of the Financial Conduct Authority.
Insurers must be authorised to carry out business in the relevant classes of insurance listed in II.1.6.
This competition does not include a requirement for insurance broking services and insurance brokers are not eligible to participate in the tender.
